title: Jaap Stam reveals Newcastle approached him to replace Rafael Benitez as club's boss in summer
text:
Jaap Stam has revealed that Newcastle approached him to become their new manager in the summer but he couldn't accept their offer as he had already agreed to take charge of Feyenoord.

Newcastle were on the lookout for a new manager after Rafa Benitez departed St. James' Park following the expiry of his contract in June.

Stam was sounded out as a possible replacement, but had already agreed a deal in March to become Feyenoord manager at the start of the current campaign, with Newcastle subsequently turning to Steve Bruce instead.

Jaap Stam has revealed that Newcastle approached him to replace Rafa Benitez in the summer

Stam was sounded out as a replacement for Benitez but had agreed to manage Feyenoord

Stam told Voetbal International: 'You have been informed, because it is correct. Newcastle United contacted me a few days after I agreed to manage Feyenoord. So it was not an option right away.

'I am a man of my word. It was beautiful and honourable, because the people in England apparently know what I stand for as a coach.'

Former Manchester United defender Stam started his managerial career in England with a spell at Reading.

Stam's Feyenoord are 10th in the Eredivisie while Newcastle are 18th in the Premier League

After being unable to secure the services of Stam, Newcastle turned to Steve Bruce instead

In 2018, Stam returned to Holland as manager of PEC Zwolle.

Stam's Feyenoord are currently in 10th place in the Eredivisie having taken 14 points from their first 10 league games.

Newcastle, meanwhile, are in 18th place in the Premier League and have won just two league games so far this season, although those victories did come against Tottenham and Manchester United.
description: Jaap Stam has revealed that Newcastle approached him to become their new manager in the summer but he couldn't accept as he had already agreed to take charge of Feyenoord.
